tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"This is for the director of music to use in worship."

tn.ref: A psalm of David the servant of Yahweh
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) David wrote the psalm or 2) the psalm is about David or 3) the psalm is in the style of David's psalms.
Sin is described as if it were a false prophet. AT: "Sin is like a false prophet who speaks" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: in the heart of the wicked man
tn.text: Here "heart" refers to the inner being of a person. AT: "to the inner being of the wicked man" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This does not refer to a specific man, but to wicked people in general. AT: "the wicked people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
Here "eyes" refers to the wicked person. AT: "in him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"he prefers to believe" or "he wants to think"

tn.ref: his sin will not be discovered and be hated
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will not discover and hate his sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to his statements. AT: "What he says is" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"good" can be stated in another form. AT: "do things that are good" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: he sets out on an evil way
tn.text: The sinful actions of the man are spoken of as if he was walking along a path that was evil. AT: "he begins to do evil things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"evil" can be stated in another form. AT: "he does not reject evil behavior." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The greatness of God's covenant faithfulness is spoken of as if it was very high. AT: "is as high as the heavens" or "is enormously great" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The greatness of God's loyalty is spoken of as if it was very high. AT: "is as high as the clouds" or "is enormously great" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: like the mountains of God ... like the great deep
tn.text: These phrases describe the greatness of God's righteousness and judgments as if they were very high and deep. AT: "as high as the highest mountains ... as deep as the deepest sea" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"you help" or "you save"

tn.ref: How precious is your covenant faithfulness
tn.text: God's covenant faithfulness is spoken of as if it were rare and expensive jewels. AT: "Your covenant faithfulness is as valuable as rare jewels" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"People will seek protection"

tn.ref: Humanity takes refuge under the shadow of your wings
tn.text: God does not really have wings. This is a metaphor for God's protection. AT: "Humanity takes refuge with you like young birds seek protection under the wings of their mother" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "You will abundantly satisfy them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: with the richness of the food of your house
tn.text: This does not mean that God has a house with food. This is a metaphor for abundant provision. AT: "as if they were eating the rich food from your house" or "with your rich blessings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: you will let them drink from the river of your precious blessings
tn.text: There are two metaphors here. God's abundant blessings are spoken of as if they are the water in a flowing river. Also, those who receive those blessings are spoken of as if they are drinking them like water. AT: "your precious blessings are like a river from which you will let them drink" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"source of life"

tn.ref: in your light we will see light
tn.text: Here "light" is a metaphor for true knowledge. AT: "when you enlighten us, we will know the truth" or "your light is what enables us to know the truth about you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"Continue your covenant faithfulness"

tn.ref: your defense to the upright of heart
tn.text: The abstract noun "defense" can be stated as a verb. "Continue" is implied from the previous phrase. AT: "Continue to protect the upright of heart" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Here "heart" refers to the people. AT: "the upright" or "people who act righteously" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: the foot of the arrogant man ... the hand of the wicked
tn.text: Here "foot" and "hand" refer to the evil people. These are not specific men. This refers to evil people in general. AT: "arrogant people ... wicked people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
"send me away" or "make me leave my place"

tn.ref: evildoers have fallen; they are knocked down and are not able to get up
tn.text: All three phrases describe the evildoers as defeated. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This can be stated in active form. AT:  "you have knocked them down" or "you have destroyed them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: are not able to get up
tn.text: "cannot get up"
